translation.text: Due to a freight train with mechanical problems at Jannali. Services in both directions will experience delays with stopping patterns and platforms to change at short notice. Please listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps before boarding services.

Airport & South Line, Bankstown Line, Blue Mountains Line, Central Coast & Newcastle Line, Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line, Inner West & Leppington Line, North Shore Line, Northern Line, South Coast Line, Southern Highlands Line, Western Line

With the current weather conditions affecting roads and public transport across Greater Sydney, you are urged to minimise non-essential travel especially around affected areas as further road closures and evacuation orders are expected.

If possible you should work from home and avoid unnecessary travel.
For further details go to  transportnsw.info/news/2021/flood-update-avoid-unnecessary-travel

For more information on how to prepare for storms and floods visit ses.nsw.gov.au

Trains have been suspended between Schofields and Richmond in both directions due to flooding in the area. Richmond trains will terminate at and commence from Schofields.

Direct buses are operating between Richmond and Schofields in both directions.  Buses are also operating between Windsor, Riverstone and Schofields stations only. These buses will not operate to or from Richmond. Buses are unable to access Vineyard, Mulgrave, Clarendon and East Richmond stations due to road closures in the area. Delays are expected. Please listen to announcements and check station information screens for service updates. Please continue to allow plenty of additional travel time.  At this stage there is no forecast of when trains services will return to normal.

With the current weather conditions affecting roads and public transport across Greater Sydney, we are urging customers to plan ahead.
If possible customers should work from home and avoid unnecessary travel particularly in flood affected areas.
For the latest go to transportnsw.info

Train services are currently running at a reduced frequency due to a train requiring mechanical repairs earlier.  You can also utilise local bus routes 525 & 526. Please allow additional travel time, listen to announcements and check information screens and transport apps for updates.  At this stage there is no forecast of when services will return to normal.  Further updates will be provided as information becomes available.
Central Coast & Newcastle Line - Partial Closure

Buses are replacing trains between Fassifern and Newcastle Interchange in both directions due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Cockle Creek.

At this stage, there is no forecast on when the line can reopen. Please delay any non-essential travel. If you must travel allow plenty of additional travel time.

Buses continue to replace trains between Newcastle Interchange, Maitland and Scone/Dungog due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Sandgate.

At this stage, there is no forecast on when the line can reopen.
Please avoid non-essential travel, if you must travel please allow plenty of extra travel time.
Doonside, Rooty Hill, Mt Druitt, St Marys, Werrington, Kingswood, Penrith due to flooding between Richmond and Schofields.

Due to a freight train with mechanical problems at Jannali. Please allow additional travel time.
Due to wet weather conditions causing slower boarding times at various locations. Please allow additional travel time.
Buses replace trains between Fassifern and Newcastle Interchange in both directions due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Cockle Creek
due to temporary speed restrictions caused by wet weather conditions.  Please allow additional travel time.
Due to a train requiring mechanical repairs earlier. Please allow additional travel time.
due to flooding between Schofields and Richmond.
due to a train requiring mechanical repairs earlier.

Cancelled due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Sandgate and between Maitland and Dungog/ Scone. 

A limited number of replacement buses are in operation. 

Please avoid any non-essential travel or make your own arrangements if possible. If you must travel, please allow plenty of additional travel time.
This train will consist of 4 carriages instead of 8 carriages.  Please move along the platform to board this service.
Toilet facilities on this service are not available. All carriages are open and customers should speak to the train guard for any assistance required.
The second, third and fifth carriages of this train are locked off and not accessible. Please board another carriage of this train
The lift between the concourse and platform 1 is temporarily out of service. For assistance ask staff or call 9847 8458.
The lift between the concourse and Platforms 3/4 is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 0298517204.
The lift between the concourse and platforms 1/2 is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9851 7431.
The lift between the concourse and Boys Avenue is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or call 9851 7212.
The lift between the concourse and Railway Parade is temporarily out of service.
The lift between platform 1 and Merrylands Road is temporarily out of service. For assistance ask station staff or call 9637 1634.
The lift between the concourse and platforms 1/2 is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone  9379 7702.
The lift between the concourse and platforms 1 & 2 is temporarily out of service. For any assistance, ask staff or call 9563 7549.
The lift between the footbridge and Howarth St is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 4353 1915.
The lift between platform 1, the concourse and street level is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 4223 5583.
The lift between the concourse and Station street is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9752 8431.
The lift between the concourse and Railway Street is temporarily out of service. For assistance ask station staff or call 9673 3059.
The lift between the concourse and the northern carpark on Railway Terrace is temporarily out of service. For assistance ask station staff or call 9851 7244.
Please take extra care on the platform during platform renewal works and stand behind the yellow line on the platform prior to boarding your train.
Station Update - Mulgrave, Vineyard, Clarendon and more
Due to local flooding buses are unable to access Vineyard, Mulgrave, Clarendon and East Richmond stations. Please avoid travelling in the affected areas.

There are changes happening at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works. Access to certain areas of the station and platforms may mean using different stairs, escalators and lifts. Please follow the signs and staff directions. If you need assistance, see station staff. For detailed information please visit https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/6049959

From 11 January to end-December 2021, the escalators and staircase connecting the corner of Pitt Street and Eddy Avenue with the Grand Concourse and L1 Light Rail stop will be closed due to station upgrade works. 

To access the Grand Concourse and Platforms 1 to 12 from the street level, please use the Western Forecourt entry via Pitt Street. To access Platforms 16 to 25 from the street level, please use the Eddy Avenue entry. 

To access Pitt Street or Eddy Avenue from the Grand Concourse or L1 light rail stop, please exit the station via the Western Forecourt or Northern Concourse.

Buses are replacing trains between Fassifern and Newcastle Interchange due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Cockle Creek.

Please allow additional travel time.

Due to external power supply issues affecting station infrastructure there is currently no power at Liverpool station. Station indicator boards are currently not available, lifts are out of service and Opal is also affected. Customers are advised to request a fare adjustment at transportnsw.info/opal
Due to station redevelopment work some platforms have reduced capacity. Please avoid standing in front of construction zones and remain behind the yellow line on the platform

Platforms 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works. A new Metro concourse is being constructed on the northern end of Sydenham Station. While the concourse is being installed, please board and alight from the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please ask staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info
